Ceremony Held at Cuban School 
    Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of laying a floral basket before the portrait of President Kim Il Sung was held at the Kim Il Sung Economic Special School in Cuba on Dec. 31 last year on the occasion of the New Year.
 Present there were the chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, the principal and the teaching staff of the school.
 The participants laid the floral basket before the portrait of the President at the school building and paid homage to him.

Settlement of Issue of "Comfort Women" Urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps held the 689th Wednesday rally in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul on Dec. 28 last year for the solution of the issue of the "comfort women" for the imperial Japanese army, according to the south Korean KBS.
 The participants in the rally paid homage to the deceased "comfort women," noting that 17 of the 218 old women registered by the "government" as former "comfort women" died in 2005.

articles.content:
Historic Oaths Come True in DPRK
    Pyongyang, January 3 (KCNA) -- The historic oaths of leader Kim Jong Il have come true in Kim Il Sung Korea.
 On January 1, Juche 35 (1946), the first New Year's Day in the liberated country, President Kim Il Sung, together with anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk and young Kim Jong Il, went to Mangyongdae, his native town.
 The great persons of Mt. Paektu offered their New Year's greetings to the grandparents and spent the day, looking back on the past with them.
 Next day grandfather Kim Po Hyon took an ink-stone out of a chest and put it before young Kim Jong Il, asking him what he would like to write.
  His mother Kim Jong Suk rubbed an ink-stick on the ink-stone. After pondering for a while, he took a writing-brush and wrote the words "Long Live General Kim Il Sung!"    
 The meaningful words reflected his firm resolution to glorify Korea liberated by the President, holding him in high esteem.    
 Kim Jong Il also made a historic oath on Ryongnam Hill on September 1, 1960 when he was admitted to Kim Il Sung University.
 In the famous work "Korea, I Will Glorify Thee", he expressed his iron will to learn the lofty ideas of the President and glorify Korea with the responsibility for the Korean revolution.    
 True to the historic oaths associated with his ardent loyalty and patriotism, he has led Korea along the road of victory and glory.
 Today Kim Il Sung Korea is vigorously advancing forward, shedding brilliant rays all over the world.
